transportAdvice: Napa Valley has limited public transit, with a regional bus network that connects some towns but does not comprehensively cover wine country attractions, making a rental car the most practical option for most visitors. Taxis and ride-hail services are available but can be sparse outside of town centers, and walking between wineries is generally not feasible given the rural, spread-out nature of the region.

weather.description: Cool and wet with frequent rain showers, making it the quietest and most affordable time to visit.
Still rainy and cool, but early wildflowers begin to appear and crowds remain thin.
Rain begins to taper off and temperatures warm slightly, with mustard flowers blooming between the vines.
Pleasant spring weather with mild temperatures and occasional showers, ideal for exploring the valley.
Warm and mostly dry with lush green vineyards, one of the most enjoyable months to visit.
Warm and sunny with very little rain, marking the start of the busy summer tourist season.
Hot and dry with long sunny days, peak season with high visitor numbers and elevated prices.
Consistently hot and dry, with harvest preparations beginning toward the end of the month.
Harvest season begins, bringing exciting winery activity and warm golden days with cool evenings.
Harvest continues into early October with beautiful fall foliage and comfortable temperatures.
Cooler and quieter with the first autumn rains returning and a more relaxed atmosphere across the valley.
Cold and rainy with a festive holiday atmosphere in town, and significantly fewer crowds at wineries.
